lines: Set up your computer. (instructions)
Take some time to tell me about you. (link)
Bring your computer to class with you every day starting Wed.
Work for 30 minutes on LegoAd. (instructions linked below)
Be prepared to report one stuck point (solved or not) with your group.
Finish LegoAd. (see Definition of Done at the instructions linked below)
Work for 30 minutes on LegoAd. (instructions linked below)
Post one question or answer or tip about Lego on Piazza.
return signed research form (even if you are declining to participate)
do 'Loops' worksheet (printable)
do 'Math.random' worksheet (printable)
watch Shiffman's 8.1 "What is OOP" (link)
watch Shiffman's 8.2 "Defining a Class, Part 1" (link) and take notes in your notebook.
watch Shiffman's 8.3 "Defining a Class, Part 2" (link) and take notes in your notebook.
Finish Lightning. (instructions)
prepare for test Wednesday (review slides) (check homework solutions on Piazza)
do Practice with Classes sheet, then check solutions on Piazza
do 30 minutes on the Dice project (instructions linked below) -- use Piazza if needed!
return signed field trip form
do 'Practice with Nested Loops' (printable)
finish Dice (due 3:15pm on Thursday)

write a short sketch that creates one Bacteria object which moves in a random walk around the screen (you might find it helpful to reference the Chemotaxis slides #1-28, see link in Materials section of the class page)
optional challenge: write an additional class for an object that randomly jumps around the screen, and display it
do Part 2 and Part 3 of Chemotaxis
finish Chemotaxis.
read and do Java Arithmetic packet Part 1 (optional but recommended: also do Part 2)
read and do Compound Conditionals packet
finish Practice with Arrays of Objects, and check solutions (solutions linked here)
check solutions to Java Arithmetic Part 1 (solutions linked here)
check solutions to Compound Conditionals (solutions linked here)
if (you did the optional Java Arithmetic Part 2) {email me a screenshot of your code and output};
recreate one of these optical illusions in Processings
test corrections per instructions here
in your programmer's notebook, take notes on all the slides here
finish Starfield
read the 'array' slides linked below as Starfield follow-up slides
finish these codingbat problems (REMEMBER TO LOG IN) --> Warmup-2 > arrayCount9, arrayFront9 ... Array-2 > countEvens, bigDiff ... (optional extras = Array-2 > centeredAverage, lucky13, sum28)
read and take notes on the 'interface' slides linked below as Starfield follow-up slides
finish these codingbat problems (REMEMBER TO LOG IN) --> Warmup-1 > nearHundred, posNeg, or35, icyHot, in1020, makes10, intMax, close10, in3050 ... Array-1 > firstLast6, sameFirstLast, makePi
prepare for test Friday on arrays, objects, interfaces, and basic inheritance. use the 'Checkpoint 3' resources linked below
still feeling rusty on the last test? use the 'extra resources' linked under 'Checkpoint 2' below
do Practice FRQ: Sound trimSilenceFromBeginning
review for test (see materials under 'Checkpoint 3' below)
if needed: practice with our quizlet class. catch up! finish projects! study for retakes! hooray!
optional: watch this tutorial about making a photo mosaic with Obama-era White House social media photos and bring an interesting design to show us after Thanksgiving
finish these codingbat problems (REMEMBER TO LOG IN) --> Logic-1 > fizzString, fizzString2 and Array-1 > commonEnd, rotateLeft3
do the full assignment at ParticleSystem and be ready to share the result at the start of class on Friday
NOTE: incomplete homework will result in at least ARE Block summons
finish the classwork mentioned in today's agenda on the class website (involves watching 4 EdpUzzle videos about binary number systems, and doing a practice sheet)
NOTE: incomplete homework will result in at least ARE Block summons
watch this video about arrays and complete the printable notes (linked in the video description, or pick up a paper copy from your folder in Mr. Smith's room)

read all the pages in the List and ArrayList section of the JavaReview website and solve all the embedded problems (except those on the 'More Practice' page). Be sure you at least *attempt* to solve all the problems. For each, use a pencil to sketch on paper how you solve the problem, then write your best guess answer, then check the website for the correct answer. If you get it wrong, read the explainations of the wrong and right answers.
watch this video about inheritance and complete the guided notes (distributed in class Wed or linked in the video description)
watch this video about instance variables and complete the guided notes (distributed in class Wed or linked in the video description)
install Greenfoot at this link. heads-up: it's a large download so plan ahead if you're on a slow connection
do Greenfoot Tutorial 1 linked here and Tutorial 2 linked here
